summary: This is a memorandum from the Director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) to the Assistant Inspector General for the Investigations Division, responding to the Office of Inspector General's (OIG) draft report on the investigation into BOP's custody, care, and supervision of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The BOP concurs with all eight recommendations aimed at improving policies related to suicide watch, cellmate assignments, inmate monitoring, staffing, and security procedures following Epstein's death.

keyFacts: The OIG investigated the Federal Bureau of Prisons' (BOP) custody, care, and supervision of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The BOP concurs with all eight OIG recommendations aimed at improving policies related to suicide watch, cellmate assignment, inmate monitoring, staffing, and security procedures.
The report states that the misconduct described represents a failure to follow BOP's longstanding policies, regulations, and/or laws by a small percentage of employees.
The BOP states it has already begun to evaluate nationwide trends and strengthen employee accountability in response to OIG and GAO engagements.
The BOP's new core values, announced in April 2023, include accountability, integrity, respect, compassion, and correctional excellence.
